result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Removal of a Major Part of a Vehicle

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gordon D. Lashley

defendant.name: Lashley, Gordon D.
defendant.address: 2939 Moon Ave., Apt 1, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 11:36 AM: 22CF484, 22CM353.
Defendant Gordon D. Lashley in court with Attorney William A. Schembera.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants quashed. Agreement has been reached. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
22CF484: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Felony Retail Theft-Intentionally Take ( >$500-$5,000); Repeater. Repeater acknowledged.
Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 2 Years of Probation with the following conditions:
90 Days of Jail with Huber stayed pending further order of the Court. AODA and follow through with recommendations.  Court Costs/surcharges. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Restitution in the amount of $631.21 plus the 10% surcharge for a total of $694.33.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Defendant is granted 2 days of credit.

Warrants quashed. Agreement has been reached. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
22CF484: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Felony Retail Theft-Intentionally Take ( >$500-$5,000); Repeater. Repeater acknowledged.
Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 2 Years of Probation with the following conditions:

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Restitution in the amount of $631.21 plus the 10% surcharge for a total of $694.33.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Defendant is granted 2 days of credit.

Cases called at 11:01 AM: 22CF484, 22CM353. 
Defendant Gordon D. Lashley not in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Gordon D. Lashley.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Schembera has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance and notes he recently resolved cases and was released from custody in Chippewa County.
Court orders warrants.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(2:17 PM cases 22CM353, 22CF484 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Gordon D. Lashley appeared by video, in custody in the Hennepin County Jail. Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Gordon D. Lashley. Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Attorney Schembera advises the defendant is awaiting extradition back to Wisconsin and is requesting additional time to review the offer with the defendant.
Court advises will allow one more status conference.
Status Conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11 am in person.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

(Cases 22CF484, 22CM353 are called at 11:26 AM) Defendant Gordon D. Lashley in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Gordon D. Lashley.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas in 22CF484. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. 
Status Conference in both cases: 09/02/2022 at 2:15 PM (IN PERSON).

(Cases called at 22CF484, 22CM353 are called at 9:35 AM) Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gordon D. Lashley in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Gordon D. Lashley. 
Defense requests Preliminary Hearing date for 22CF484 with 22CM353 to ride along. Preliminary Hearing: 08/02/2022 at 1:30 PM. 
(Cases 22CF484, 22CM353 are recalled at 9:49 AM) Same appearances as above. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver.  
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.
Dated 06/07/2022, Letter from Attorney William Schembera updating defendant's address.

9:48 AM cases 22CF484 and 22CM353 called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gordon D. Lashley not in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera in court for Gordon D. Lashley. State requests a warrant- so ordered. 
10:29 AM cases re called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gordon D. Lashley in court.  Attorney William A. Schembera not in court. 
Defendant was late. Warrants are quashed.
Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
